alert.note: Alert for Santa Monica Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 16 at 3:47PM PST until November 16 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT FOR WESTERN LOS ANGELES COUNTY AND MUCH OF VENTURA COUNTY THROUGH 7 PM... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR WESTERN LOS ANGELES COUNTY AND MUCH OF VENTURA COUNTY FROM 1 AM TO 10 PM SATURDAY... .Santa Ana winds will remain gusty through the early evening and slowly diminish through the night into Thursday. Very dry conditions will remain with minimum humidities of 6 to 12 percent. Another moderate to strong Santa Ana wind event is expected Friday night through Saturday. Gusty northeast winds will combined with very low humidities of 5 to 15 percent will likely support 6 or more hours of critical fire weather conditions on Saturday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY NORTHEAST WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY NORTHEAST WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Fire Weather Watch FOR GUSTY NORTHEAST WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, which is in effect from late Friday night through Saturday evening. * Winds...Northeast winds with gusts peaking 40 to 60 mph. * Relative Humidity...Minimum relative humidity of 5 to 15 percent. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidity can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution with potential fire ignition sources. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
